book.title: PsyConversion
book.text: 117 Behavior Patterns for an even better User Experience and a higher Convesion-Rate in the E-Commerce.

read.title: on why to read
read.text: As part of my UX journey I strive to constantly learn. Sure it’s great to learn the pragmatic way, but sometimes you can avoid stupid mistakes by learning what others did wrong.
read.box2: why our mind often deceives us

cards.title: Annoying
cards.text: Long textblocks on websites can be not readable or simply annoying...just look at wikipedia...if you also hate scrolling through a sea of words, just relax ;)

cards.title: Tap Tap
cards.text: If you find a particular behavior pattern or effect interesting, just tap on the plus icon. There will display a brief summary of the given pattern you wanted to learn about.

cards.title: Be a Geek
cards.text: Some of these behaviour patters are truly interesting. If you want to learn more about them. Click the button and travel to a source with more information.

cards.title: Blend
cards.text: Don’t be surprised. It’s a blend of all kinds of heuristics and behavior patterns. To make it more entertaining I did not put them in the original order.

cards.title: Smooth Scroll
cards.text: I don’t want your precious fingers to get tired. After all you probably need them to work. Thus you can easily move with swiping left and right.
